channel.title: Maid(Blue Dragon Investigator) and Waitress(Unseen Investigator) - Actually Implemented eeeeeeeeeeeee
channel.description:
##Maid
Day Ability 1: Poke Around Look in someone's Bedchambers to determine their class type - 1 use
Night Ability 1: Matchmake Try to 'hook up' 2 players, you will be told whether they are compatible or not(See Below) - Infinite Uses
Night Ability 2: Service Check a person to see if they are a Royal or not - Infinite Uses
Compatibility: Members of opposing Factions are not compatible Members of Neutral Factions are compatible with every Neutral Faction that they can win with Royals are not compatible with each other that would be wierd The King and Fool are not compatible with anyone The Mercenary is compatible with her target no matter the faction
Examples: Prince + Observer - Compatible Prince + Nightwatch - Not Compatible Duchess + Nightwatch - Compatible Duchess + Aristocrat - Not Compatible Possessor + Alchemist - Compatible Possessor + Reaper - Not Compatible Alchemist + Observer - Not Compatible
##Waitress
Day Ability 1: Poke Around See Maid
Night Ability 1: Matchmake Check 2 players to see if they're the same class type - Infinite Uses
Night Ability 2: Room Service Occupy a player - 2 Uses
Lore: To-do
Comments: Based on the Mafia role Parity Cop

item.description:
Lol how did I manage to ninja you 4 hours after the original post . hehe .

Also If you wanted to work the royal angle in I would say that royals are more likely to marry each other rather than less in a medieval setting .

Just recently the whole world went crazy when Prince William married someone not of royal blood

item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
ThePlex:

You overcomplicate things when you bring incest into it though.

She said “because it would be weird” suggesting that there is no balance reason for doing so.

I have shown that it is not weird (by medieval standards) and so it should be abolished.

Read full topic

item.description:
I am okay if you want to keep everything else, but change one thing:

royals being not compatible with each other.

it complicates things to much.

Additionally, royals did often marry within the family, to preserve there blood or something. Don’t want to get into specifics much…

item.title: Maid(Blue Dragon Investigator) and Waitress(Unseen Investigator) - Actually Implemented eeeeeeeeeeeee
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
suggested rules for compatibility:

members of opposing factions are not compatible
members of the same faction (even neutral) are compatible with each other
the mercenary is compatible with their target
scorned is compatible with everyone but their targets
fool is compatible with scorned only

Read full topic
item.source: Maid(Blue Dragon Investigator) and Waitress(Unseen Investigator) - Actually Implemented eeeeeeeeeeeee

item.title: Maid(Blue Dragon Investigator) and Waitress(Unseen Investigator) - Actually Implemented eeeeeeeeeeeee
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
Maid is by far my favourite added role, Squire a close second. After that in order it goes, eating shit, being castrated, being buried alive, all the other added roles, Moonspirit.

Seriously though Maid is beautiful. We never had a Waitress but looking at it now Waitress is actually pretty underpowered tbh. I would giver her extra uses of Poke Around imo.

I don’t think Maid herself should be changed at all though she cool af.

Read full topic
item.source: Maid(Blue Dragon Investigator) and Waitress(Unseen Investigator) - Actually Implemented eeeeeeeeeeeee

item.title: Maid(Blue Dragon Investigator) and Waitress(Unseen Investigator) - Actually Implemented eeeeeeeeeeeee
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
The only suggestion I have is to allow Royals to be matched together just because I do kinda feel like all of the special rules with compatibility makes this class extremely difficult and frustrating for newer or weaker players. I would try scrapping one of these specific rules and that would be the royal one as matching two Nobles makes complete sense.

I’m not sure what the flavor of matching is here…is Jammy implying the Maid is encouraging her targets to
uh
you know

Read full topic

item.title: Maid(Blue Dragon Investigator) and Waitress(Unseen Investigator) - Actually Implemented eeeeeeeeeeeee
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
ThePlex:

Unless you play Forum of Lies, you can’t determine if something is a “fluke” - so you don’t know anything about it being used.

“Unless you have held office, you can’t criticize politicians”

ThePlex:

This class is actually quite popular amongst the Forum of Lies community, thus, once more, it’s proven successful.

That does not address what I said, wow.

In FoL, you can spend all the time you want checking how a class works. Not so in normal games.

ThePlex:

Please, kindly not be a troll for once?

I’m not; just because someone has a different opinion from you does not mean they are a troll.

Read full topic
item.source: Maid(Blue Dragon Investigator) and Waitress(Unseen Investigator) - Actually Implemented eeeeeeeeeeeee

item.title: Maid(Blue Dragon Investigator) and Waitress(Unseen Investigator) - Actually Implemented eeeeeeeeeeeee
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
RopeStringFace:

It was a fluke, probably.

  1. Unless you play Forum of Lies, you can’t determine if something is a “fluke” - so you don’t know anything about it being used.
RopeStringFace:

Also, the problem with this class is that you have to memorize all these combinations.
Also, waitress is horridly under powered.
Lastly, maid has match make and waitress has match make, even though they do different things; this will be very confusing for new players.

  1. This class is actually quite popular amongst the Forum of Lies community, thus, once more, it’s proven successful.
RopeStringFace:

Please don’t waste space with useless filler like this.

  1. You tell me to not waste space with “useless filler” but you post about a class being considered a “fluke”

Please, kindly not be a troll for once?

Read full topic
item.source: Maid(Blue Dragon Investigator) and Waitress(Unseen Investigator) - Actually Implemented eeeeeeeeeeeee
